review: Fantastic game-changer in my house. But first, the one negative issue I've had. It would not set up and connect to my wifi for the first few tries. Googling issues led me down wifi settings and router issues. Ended up the fix was much simpler: I had to keep the default name of the device. Something like "Chromecast7023." I couldn't change it. After keeping the default name, it's never had an issue.I bring it with me when travelling, pairing with a TP-LINK TL-WR702N Wireless N150 Travel Router ($17), to use on hotel internet.I've given two out as gifts to my parents and inlaws. They're not tech savvy by any means and they both love it.The current setup I use is my Chromecast to a receiver and then HDMI out to my TV. All works great. I can keep the TV off and just hear music through the receiver's speakers.
